website_summaries.verdict: Don't bet on Petnet's SmartFeeder to feed your dog or cat the correct amount at the correct time.
pros: The $149 Petnet SmartFeeder comfortably stored several pounds of my dog's dry food and dispensed scheduled, portioned meals automatically (for the most part)
cons: Dispensed food regularly collected between the reservoir and the bowl where my dog couldn't reach.
The dispenser clogged once, resulting in a partial feeding
on another occasion, the SmartFeeder didn't release any food or notify me of a problem

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Your pet will starve. Please dont trust petnet. They are so shady. Their system has continuously gone down. I wish I was never recommended this product years ago. Waste of money. Just do a search on the internet as see for yourself. Their entire system went down Feb 2020 for an entire week. And again April 2020, they are down again except they have totally gone dark. Location closed. Phone line disconnected. No responses to social media complaints. I really hope I can get my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Health nut

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT AND COMPANY-SEARCH REVIEWS FIRST
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to read my review. Search for Petnet on Twitter and Facebook and see how many of us are fed up with the company. Avoid this company and product. Their servers go down on a regular basis for weeks at a time. Their app becomes inoperable on a regular basis for weeks at a time. Without their server and/or app, this product is useless and your pets will go hungry. Now, after 2 months of no service or customer service communication, they are back online and want to start selling a $30 annual or $4 monthly subscription to continue to have access to their server. They will take your money and your pet will be hungry.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for the Quailty
customer_reviews.text: We have sent this Item back once already due to the rubber ball inside falling apart and putting tiny rubber chunks in our Dogs food. They sent us a replacement unit and now the auto feed only work half the time and doesn't register the night feeding. So we have to always push the button or hit the feed button on our phone. Overall was a cool Concept but for the price you pay for this unit I wish the quality was better. Not happy Overall and wont suggest on buying this
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ploesser

customer_reviews.title: Petnet is down since February 2020
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! PetNet had a major outage in February 2020 and again starting April 13, 2020. It’s not April 18th and they are ghosting all of their customers. Not responding to support tickets, not updating on Twitter, and so on. There is no way to trust them with something as important as feeding your pets when this is how they treat their loyal customers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Company went bankrupt and now the product doesn't work. False advertising. It's a food dish and nothing more
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Holsopple

customer_reviews.title: PETNET is seems to be shutting down and the device has stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this feeder for a long time, but it seems like the company is either temporarily or permanently out of business and unfortunately, the feeder doesn't work without the app and whatever made the app work seems to not be working anymore. Check their support Twitter; a lot of people who have been using this to feed their pets are no longer able to and I wouldn't imagine, at this point, any new users would even be able to set it up. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Falletti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Space Cadets
customer_reviews.text: One thing I've noticed about cats: they're creatures of habit, so when my poor kitty depends on her A.D.D.-riddled human to feed her at whatever random hour, it's not great. Now my kitty gets fed at exactly the same time every day, and she gets fed the recommended amount for her weight and age. It’s also great to know that I can take a weekend trip and not worry about her getting fed. Thanks, PetNetTM!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Seems like they have closed up shop - multiple people report units not working
customer_reviews.text: Heard that folks were having problems. Reports online that they have closed up shop. Mine was running based on last programming till a few days ago. Cannot connect to it, the app gives an SSL error. You can't login to your account on the website. Now the only way it works is to hit the button on the front.
customer_reviews.author: NM4M

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wifi and lack of customer service
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it was great. But too often it was glitchy in terms of the app and processing feed requests. The system has been offline and unable to connect to wifi for over five days now, resulting in zero timed nightly feedings for our cat...and zero sleep for us as he wakes us all night wondering when he’ll eat again.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Complete Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Quick working while on vacation - almost starved the cat! Worked again for a short period until we got new WiFi then despite getting a replacement from the company, it still never would connect or work. They had the most basic (millennial) non-professional, poorly thought out answers for everything. Basically it was brought to market before complete testing. Threw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Product. Completely Absent Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of recent reviews, after about a year, this $120 machine has become useless. The belt that feeds the food no longer has any rubber teeth left (no idea where those went), and food no longer dispenses accurately nor properly. I emailed customer service a month ago and still haven’t received any response back. I would stay far away from this feeder and will be purchasing a new one from a different company that cares about its customers. I am pretty disappointed that a product that worked so well fell apart within a year and that this company ignores its customer.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE...while this feeder started off good....bought 2. The customer service failed miserably over the last two years and have now completely disappeared!!!! If you buy this feeder, you most likely will not be able to connect it. We have two, they have been down due to a server issue for about a month and have become $125 paperweights! No answers from customer service and only one tweet about a problem....and I only found that by accident. Look for another feeder as we have to now. Amazon should remove these folks from their platform!!!...or find out where they disappeared too. Do Not Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Kstop

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for travelers or pets that need a small amt of food many times a day
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. It is amazing for our cat that tends to over eat. He needs small portions many times a day and needless to say we are not home all day to be able to do this. This provides the perfect solution. We also went on a 2 week vacation and left our cat with a friend but it was nice knowing they didn't have to worry about feeding times. It can be a little difficult to connect to wifi the first time but just follow the instructions and it will work. You will have to reconnect should you move to different wifis but once I connected to wifi a second time, it was much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product DOES NOT WORK!  App no longer supported
customer_reviews.text: APP NO LONGER WORKS! Anyone who bought this feeder can NO LONGER use this product. I paid $120 for this feeder & now it is garbage. I tried to contact support for help, but No response back. No customer service support available.
customer_reviews.author: K. March

customer_reviews.title: High-tech, cat starvation device
customer_reviews.text: It looks like the company went out of business. The app stopped working, the feeder stopped working, the website account portion of the website stopped working, and their last tweet was 10 days ago stating they were still down. Outside of leaving us all in the lurch and endangering animals, the device and service were excellent. I hope they come back in some form and I'll change this review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very flawed product. The feeder consistantly disconnects from the WiFi. When the feeder does decide to operate, the feeding portions are all wrong. Have called customer service and left muItiple messages, no response. Haven’t had a response from my email either. I have never had this much problem from a purchase before. Amazon should seriously Discontinue selling this product. If you care about your pet please please please do NOT purchase this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: it hasnt worked in weeks because their "servers are down". . . .no option to feed the pets without their servers. make sure if you get a different brand that you are able to operate it if the company goes dark. . . which petnet seems to have done. . really, this should be taken off of amazon ASAP. and off the market completely....
customer_reviews.author: lemondragon

customer_reviews.title: Feeder has some bad design flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this feeder for 5 years and for the most part been happy with it. However there are a couple of issues. The rubber band that’s in the feeder dispensing mechanism broke and there were rubber pieces coming out with the food. This happened within the first year of having the feeder. It also skips feeds occasionally. And now there’s some kind of glitch that Petnet says they are working on. The feeder doesn’t work at all unless you push the button on the front of the feeder. This has been going on for 2 weeks. Really annoyed at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Martina Pembaur

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. I bought 2 of these and were great while they worked. You can no longer access the app to change anything from portion size to turning on or off feedings. Customer support for this product vanished. These shouldn't even be allowed on Amazon since you won't be able to get them to work. Complete waste of money. I now have to buy 2 more of another brand to be able to operate again.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Hawker

customer_reviews.title: Huge blessing! Solved our annoying cat crying issues!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Our cats share one bowl, and it has saved me a ton of annoyance in the mornings. I set the SmartFeeder to automatically feed the cats at 5:30am which prevents our oldest cat from crying outside our bedroom door and smacking the doorknob with his paw. It was unbelievably annoying and this has completely solved the problem. I am very satisfied. Make sure to request the the SmartFeed Ramp from the PetNet website when your product arrives. It will add an incline to help the food reach the front of the bowl. I have recommended this product to many people :)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Maher

customer_reviews.title: Out of business - no longer works.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. They poorly structured their system, and now 3rd party service providers have stopped their service. I can no longer access my machine. They are asking customers to switch to a subscription model to dispense their pet food. I’ve emailed them three times asking for local control of my machine and don’t even get a courtesy response. Don’t bother purchasing this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: The packaging was amazing. It felt like a quality product
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited that this feeder would work for us. The packaging was amazing. It felt like a quality product. However, once we got it set up (which was very easy) we could not change the feeding size. It was stuck on a 1/4 cup, but we feel it was giving more like almost a full cut and no matter what we set it to it continued to feed the same large amount. Also, the food does not slide down the shoot, so eventually in gets jammed up and sends us an alert to clear the jam. This is because the shoot is made with very little slope to it, it's almost horizontal. I am returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Cirrus22Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good interface and holds a decent amount of food, not good at feeding
customer_reviews.text: Good interface and holds a decent amount of food. Not all food slides down into the bowl, which for a frisky dog (mine is not) might scratch at to get the rest. After using this for a while longer, I had to come back and make an update to my review. For the better part of a week, I had to clear out the bowl's food slide each time so that the food did not back up and jam the autofeeder. I am going to try a different set of food, but this one has become very frustrating as it it not so effort free.....
customer_reviews.author: FunReviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this feeder! It is nice looking and well engineered. It is very sturdy and is impenetrable by curious, hungry cats. I am gone a lot for work, but I can feed my cat right from my phone! I can even set up automatic feedings and the app shows that it has completed them. There are numerous serving sizes to choose from and you can set up as many feeding times as you want. The app could still use a bit of work, but overall I am very satisfied with this feeding system!!
customer_reviews.author: sbaker

customer_reviews.title: PetNet Out Of Business
customer_reviews.text: PetNet seems to have went under as a company. Application to control the feeder no longer works. No local options to feed. This entire product no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Notification for hopper empty or missed feedings not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I just want to warn everyone to please check the hopper level weekly and do not rely on the alerts the system is supposed to send to your phone. I have all alerts set up but just opened the hopper to find it completely empty. I could have starved my cat to death. I know she had food 4 days ago when I was home and heard it drop but I'm usually at work during feeding times. The hopper is poorly designed in black instead of transparent so you can't see if the food level is diminishing. I'm so disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!  Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The best cat feeder ever! This thing is really well made, and it works with an app that notifies you when the cats get fed, when it's empty, if it jams, and other things. You can manually send a treat via the app, or via a button on the front. You can turn off the use of the button if your pet figures out how to give itself a treat! It holds a lot, its great for those who are gone a lot or who travel, and it doesnt fall apart like other feeders. The top cannot be taken off by a pet either. 5 stars! Love it! Wouldn't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: my FIRST unit randomly stopped working and it looks like the second one just called it quits
customer_reviews.text: This device is not worth the money. I use it to feed my cat and it was constantly getting jammed. I got this unit to give me a peace of mind while leaving my cat alone and more often than not I would get notifications that the unit was jammed and unable to complete a feeding. Also, my FIRST unit randomly stopped working and it looks like the second one just called it quits. Petnet sent me a whole new unit and made the replacement process very easy, but the hassle of this product is not worth $150.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quad

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves getting served by this electronic Chef
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very easy set-up and configuration. Sturdy, micro-USB powered, battery backup powered, very sturdy stainless bowl. Cons: Would be nice if the app provided more analytics and when my kitty actually used the feeder. Pro-tip if you are using an Apple Airport Express base station: during the initial setup, the petnet tried to configure itself to use the 5GHz wifi signal from the Airport Express. The Petnet is only capable of 2.4GHz Wifi, but that is not expressly said on the manual or documentation. Make sure you select a 2.4GHz Wifi network during the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio H

customer_reviews.title: Our cat died while on vacation, because of this trash! SCAM!!! No longer works!
customer_reviews.text: App doesn't work any more. Feeder no longer works and pets aren't being fed anymore! Now we have to feed our pets that are still alive with a scoop. This is an expensive piece of junk! We recently had to bury our kitten Mew Mew. Because while we were on vacation in Belize are poor precious Mew Mew was not fed because the feeder quit working! Her lifeless withered body was found in front of the fridge by my 3 year old daughter! Our family will never be the same. My daughter is now in therapy 3x a week! I only hope she stops having night terrors about her poor kitten dieing slowly, all alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: We never received an activation email from the "company" to set up an account. We bought it as a backup feeder a couple of years ago and now that we need it, the product decides not to set up. Ugh. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa De Bartolo

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this feeder - we will be returning it
customer_reviews.text: We just used this feeder for our cats while out of town for the holidays. Multiple issues while we see our of town including missed feeds due to server issues, then spitting out 9 meals at once once the servers came back up because my husband had tried to manually force feeds while it was having problems. Do not recommend this feeder - we will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Eva P

customer_reviews.title: Company has folded
customer_reviews.text: With all the connectivity problems and now the company has folded. Literally useless product you can't register which means you can't use it
customer_reviews.author: Justin F.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a while back. It was broken for a while and I reached out to their customer service for MONTHS via multiple mediums and never got a response back. After about sic months, I had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: SSIreads

customer_reviews.title: I can sleep again!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this feeder, my fiancee and I can sleep in on weekends again. My cat used to wake us up every morning at about 630-7, begging us to feed her. It was extremely annoying, especially since she's a total fat kid and loves food. My only complaint is that not all the food falls down into the dish, it's like the ramp from the hopper to the bowl need to be just a little steeper. My cat has figured out how to paw out the extra food though and to me it's something that keeps her entertained so all in all it's not a real issue.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Can't associate multiple with one account, feeder jams, and customer service was mixed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my cats because if they're unattended one will push the other away. You can't associate multiple feeders with a single account so I had to go through the exhausting and buggy setup process twice. Overall, 3 phone calls with customer service later, I got it set up on two separate mobile phones. I mailed customer service about problems I was having, and they never even responded. Also, the feeder often get's stuck, and I have no idea that's happened. It doesn't give me confidence to leave my pets away. The user interface is incredibly confusing, and spends too much time asking for completely useless info.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this feeder last December and really liked it. Worked well but had a tendency to get blocked up. Eventually I started finding rubber type pieces in my cat's food. Today I found my cat playing with one of the pieces. That was the end of this item. I called Petnet twice. The message advised no pet care operators were not available and to leave a message. Now Three messages later no response. Bye Bye
customer_reviews.author: Steven K.

customer_reviews.title: You may not like it, but this is what peak performance looks like.
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats could reach into each feeder and drop food all day until I pimped out these bad boys with the sleek addition of cardboard and gaff tape. The second generation feeder is even easier for cats to steal from, please fix this in the third generation feeder.
customer_reviews.author: NA LW

customer_reviews.title: And since it's useless without phone capability
customer_reviews.text: Have a last minute trip out of town, bought this to feed my cat while I'm gone. It won't sync to my phone even though I've followed all their troubleshooting advice. And since it's useless without phone capability, I am SOL. This thing is a complete piece of crap. I should have gone with the "old school" version that I could at least program using the led screen. What a stupid purchase. Will be sending back for a refund ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: tankdayglo

customer_reviews.title: Free Riser Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this feeder for at least two years and had no problems with it. Personally, I had no issues setting it up. Love the new ramp/riser that was offered and sent for free. I would walk in every morning to see one of my cats with his paw up in the chute trying to get free kibble! Wonder how long it is going to take him to figure out that gig is up. I’m alarmed to read about the chute material issues. No issue so far for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lonsdale

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had it a week, it connects to my iPhone fine. Days after having it I was noticing the food I use not falling out the greatest. Then without even complaining I receive an email for a free plastic ramp piece you attach under the feeder. I just received that, and that's so far seems to Improve its performance. Good customer service right there. I have it set to feed my dog twice a day. It's cool how the phone app pulls up all the nutritional info etc when you input your dog food. So far I'm liking this thing as is my dog. Hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes jams with no indication to user
customer_reviews.text: The feeder sometimes jams with no indication to the user. You would think that when the auger didn't turn, it'd notify you on the app. Nope! Instead, I got a message that my dog had been fed 1 cup of dog food when only a few pieces dropped into the tray. Even after switching dog foods (and also using the tray they optionally send), I get occasional problems with the auger jamming. Other than that, the product is fine. The app is easy to use and the feeder is aesthetically pleasing. I'm frustrated by the lack of product reliability for something as important as feeding my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm really liking this cat feeder, it's much more ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really liking this cat feeder, it's much more user friendly compared to my old one. A few things for improvement: Have backup batteries that last for a few days (like D size batteries), and also allow users to manage more than one PetNet in the app. I have two cats that need to be feed in separate rooms, and I can't just dump more food into the one I have because the one cat will just eat all of the food. I want to give you more money, so please support more than one per phone!
customer_reviews.author: Frostling

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has food issues and this has been the best auto feeder to get him 3 easy smaller meals per day. He started "breaking in" to the other auto feeder and stealing food. The lid on this is locked tight. He finds it a little spooky but has made a huge difference in our life. Highly recommend this feeder. Connecting to WiFi wasn't hard if you follow the instructions. It was different process. Camera would be nice. The free base was offered after purchase via email to provide more if a tilt so the food falls down better.
customer_reviews.author: mittens71671

customer_reviews.title: They actually removed customer service...
customer_reviews.text: So, the biggest issue with this thing, is that the food doesn't come out of the hopper, even with the slanted ramp they give you. After owning it for a month, the hopper also stopped telling me when it was low. I email them via the app, and they said an update was in the works. Fast forward to update, not only did they NOT update the hopper, but they removed the customer service contact info option within it. Talk about greasy. I can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletonkey IFOR

customer_reviews.title: Inside deteriorated over 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for the first 2 years I had it, but then the "insides" started to deteriorate and started coming out in pieces in my cat's food/meal times. It is now officially useless and I use it as an auto feeding bowl but cannot be set on the timer anymore as it doesn't measure proper amounts anymore. I hate to give it a bad review but this company must figure out a different material for the rubber bits inside that help portion the food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable pet feeder.
customer_reviews.text: The electronic functions only works when the tray is inserted firmly. Unfortunately, it was loose and had to be held in place to work. I used packing tape. Anyway, this product is very unreliable. My goal was to leave my cats alone for a few days while this feeder fed them. This product did not work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sung

customer_reviews.title: This product has been fantastic for us
customer_reviews.text: This product has been fantastic for us. We are still waiting on an android app, but other than that these units are great. We did have some of the connection issues mentioned by other users, but I just wanted to come on here to point out Petnet's fantastic customer service. We were contacted out of the blue regarding these connection issues, and had new bases sent out free of charge within a few days. These new bases have worked perfectly, so it seems the issue has been corrected. If you're hesitating to buy because of these connection issues, then don't!
customer_reviews.author: Amy810

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Been a couple weeks since I bought it. Working great so far! My cat is obsessed with food, and after 7 years of her life, still hasn't associated binging with the follow-up "upset stomach." This would leave me with daily messes to clean. So, I use this cat feeder for portion control, and it has made significant improvements. Smallest portion sizes (1/16th cup) several times a day. I am still dialing it in, so I do a few manual feedings in the afternoon. So far, I haven't stress tested it with things such as turn off WIFI for days, or uninstall app from phone etc. When/if I do, I will update. Worth the money so far; go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Two thing I didn't understand until after purchase. #1, The angled base is not included in the package but provided upon request at no charge. I recommend doing this to reduce food getting jammed. #2, The unit "charges" using a provided USB cable but the unit need to be permanently plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase! Flawed product and horrible company.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from numerous other reviews, the plastic flaps on the transport conveyor disintegrate and fall off into your cats food. In our situation, our cat ate these pieces and became very sick. We spent over 2 thousand dollars on vet bills. Of course, we are very understanding people and we contact PetNet to let them know and to ask for the newer model (which hopefully has this design flaw fixed) because prior to the issue we really liked and enjoyed this product. Unfortunately, this company has not responded to any of out multiple inquires on multiple platforms. Basically, DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. FLAWED PRODUCT DESIGN AND HORRIBLE COMPANY.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Greer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work - expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this for over a year and assumed it was user error but I have not gotten this to work. I haven’t tried to send it back to the seller because I don’t know if there was something I’m doing wrong (I’m following all instructions to the letter) or if this was a scam product. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Why does this need to be connected to the cloud?
customer_reviews.text: We loved this pet feeder until petnet went dark. Now it is essentially and expensive paper weight. I know devices using the cloud are cool and all but it is absolutely unneeded for a device like this. You could have a web interface locally that the app communicates with. Its just not a robust software design.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Beta version was frustrating, but the final version is FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I went through two beta versions of this product and was very frustrated. It jammed, it didn't feed, it sent faulty messages to my phone, etc., etc. The good news is the customer service reps at PetNet are amazing and very accommodating and kept working with me. So, I stuck with it and got my third feeder which was a final version (not a beta version) and it is AWESOME! Now I don't have to get up early to feed my dog, or race home in the afternoon to feed my dog - the pet feeder does it flawlessly. And, I can check from my phone to make sure it's been done. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: SKell

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive about this product, as I have two cats, however it has worked out great! I really love that you can schedule feedings, as I prefer to feed my cats several small meals a day, rather than one or two large meals morning and evening. My only qualm is how much information it requires to get it started, honestly, I don't need recommendations on how much to feed my cat. He's in good health, and he likes the food he eats. Love: - Feeder Low Notifications - Offline Notifications - How easy it is to clean the feeder - It continues to do the automatic schedule even when offline
customer_reviews.author: Sorchops

customer_reviews.title: Company Bankrupt, deleted their website, will not work- DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all..... they went out of business and the only way to get it to work is by modifying the board inside the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Duke McFlanagan

customer_reviews.title: This has been fantastic for our 2 cats
customer_reviews.text: This has been fantastic for our 2 cats. We have scheduled 5 small feedings a day and our cats are very happy about it. The consistency has put them at ease. Cats are routine animals and this they can count on. They no longer bug us to feed them in the morning or evening. It has been a dream. Only downside is you can only put one pets profile in the app. So we did the caloric intake math for two cats and have it schedule under one cat. The bowl is big enough for them to share with no issues. Love it! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Had a few minor issues in the beginning but the customer service is OUTSTANDING. They make sure you're taken care of, they follow-up and the attention to detail is great. The feeder is amazing. I love the ease of use of the app...I can just click once and it'll auto feed my dog. It automatically feeds him the amounts of food I want at specific times of the day using the scheduling function. It also alerts you if it's disconnected, if the feeder is low on food, etc. WAY more options and works WAY better than other auto feeders I've had. I'll def be buying another one when I get another pet. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: danimal77

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy Until Company Confirms...
customer_reviews.text: I think they went out of business. App hasn't worked for a few weeks which makes this a $200 paper weight. This is a bit more than speculation and seems to be all users. Check their Twitter. This sucks, cause I liked the product. Finicky setup, but after it was great.
customer_reviews.author: TWIYJaded

customer_reviews.title: It breaks and the company doesn’t respond to support tickets.
customer_reviews.text: There is no camera. It lasted for about 1.5 years, then the motor burned out. It happened while we were on vacation out of the country. It put our cat’s life at risk. Considering taking legal action against this company. I have opened a support case, but they haven’t responded in 72 hours.
customer_reviews.author: M Schwei

customer_reviews.title: Company no longer able to support products
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for years, and the company appears to be going under. The app has stopped working and the feeder stops working randomly for days or weeks. It’s a shame :(
customer_reviews.author: J. Pease

customer_reviews.title: Out of business?
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the company is out of business. I haven’t been able to get notifications for months now. And now this morning I can’t even log in and my dog was not automatically fed this morning based on the feeding schedule.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Petnet has given me back a good night's sleep! Our cat's morning alarm clock for breakfast was going off way too early. With Petnet set to go off at 5:00am, our cat gets her morning feeding when she wants and we get our sleep. It's also been great for when we travel. Our pet sitter comes every day but we are also able to push snacks through the app to give her treats between feedings. The app is very user friendly. I would recommend turning the unit on and off every 4 weeks or so to reset and ensure it continues to seamlessly. I highly recommend this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: LA066

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder!!! We travel frequently and it is easy to tell and make sure our kitties are being fed. To the people that are complaining that the food is not falling all the way down into the bottom of the dish and then it is becoming clogged - this is partially true, however, if your cat is not eating all the food that is being dispensed, then you are feeding your cat too much!! Just cut down on the amount and or the number of feeds, cat eats ALL of the food dispensed - problem solved!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for helping to feed pets on schedule
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for helping to feed pets on schedule, when at home and away. Used for 2 cats, which was initially a challenge making sure both get fed right, and suppose this is ideal for a single pet use. It surprises me to think people believe this is a device that absolves them of pet owner responsibilities when on vacation, so I would still plan to have someone to check on your pet when you are away, in the event something were to go wrong? Throughout over 2 years of ownership we did not experience any major malfunctions. Compared to all the other cheap/expensive feeders out there, this is a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: stopped working properly after 7-8 months
customer_reviews.text: this product was great for about 7 months but it has now stopped working. First it had tons of issues connecting to wifi, I tried over 50 times to reconnect it to Wifi when i moved. I called customer service and was on the phone with them for an hour trying to connect. I eventually gave up for a few days. Now the feeder will not turn on or charge or light up at all. I will ask for a replacement because it was great while it worked!
customer_reviews.author: cathy herrick

customer_reviews.title: COMPANY OUT OF BUSINESS
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a great product but DO NOT BUY IT! The company went out of business because of Covid and didn’t announce it to any user. The feeder simply stopped feeding my kitty and I had no idea. Several disappointed with the lack of customer service and support during this issue. When I was working it worked great...now it’s just a hunk of technology in my place I have to throw away
customer_reviews.author: MargaretT

customer_reviews.title: This feeder has been great. So far no jams and dispenses food on ...
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has been great. So far no jams and dispenses food on time. I have pretty consistent Internet connection so haven't had problems with it ever disconnecting. I love how the bowl can be taken out easily and washed. My cat hasn't been able to open it or push the bowl out either. The app could use a little update...I put in my cat's info, but don't really know what that calculates...same with the food. There are also some feeders out there that have a webcam built in; it would be nice to see this in their next version.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Love it, wish you could connect more than one feeder to a smart device
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder. The app can be glitchy, lately I’ve been getting a message saying my Manual feed was unsuccessful, but I can hear the feeder go off, so it actually was successful. I’m using it for dry cat food and haven’t had any problem with the system jamming. My only complaint is that you can’t connect more than one feeder to your phone. I’d like to get another feeder for my two other cats but I would have to set the app up on a different smart device to control it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa J

customer_reviews.title: Blue Tooth feeded.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Feeds on time and I can do an extra feeding from my phone if I want. You HAVE to use your phone or tables with the APP for this product. You cannot program it from the machine. The App crashes often but you just re-open it and it works fine. There is supposed to be a scale function where you can see how much food is in the bowl by the weight but I do not believe it is an active feature yet. I follow the directions to see the scale and the options are not in the app so maybe it a coming upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great product for busy pet parents!
customer_reviews.text: I love our Petnet feeder. We have been using this for a few years now and it makes things so much easier! No worries if we are running late or gone for a quick overnight, I know my kitties will be fed on schedule. The app is easy to use and even allows for manual feeding from the app. I also like the notifications when the food hopper is running low. While we haven't used the feature, the program can also re-order food as well! Highly recommend this for pet parents who want to make sure their fur babies are fed on a set schedule and always have food available!
customer_reviews.author: Taryn O.

customer_reviews.title: This is so useful! The new software update makes it a little ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so useful! The new software update makes it a little harder to use though. It stopped telling me when the food was low and would just alert me when my poor kitty wouldn't get fed a meal. It also lets me know when it powers off... the plus is my 14lb over weight cat now weight 11lbs and is very close to his ideal weight of 10lbs. It has taken almost a year to figure out a schedule and food to correct his weight.
customer_reviews.author: Emlyjo

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely annoyed at the fact that the app is always having ...
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely annoyed at the fact that the app is always having issues opening. It's been a week now and anytime I try and launch the app it just gives me the blue screen and never opens. I have emailed and called the company and no response at all. This is unacceptable! I recommend anyone wanting to buy this wait for them to work out the bugs. I just I did install the app and reinstalled it and was finally able to get in and make changes on the app so I'm not sure what's going on but the fact that customer service has not gotten back to me in over a week is still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sherif

customer_reviews.title: Husband bought it for the cats and I for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought it for the cats and I for an early Christmas gift. It has worked perfectly and I haven't had any issues. Directions are straight forward so I'm not sure how people are having trouble setting it up? We have very fast internet speed and have no issues with it connecting. ALSO, the ramp tray is FREE if you need it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C

customer_reviews.title: Works great! May have to wait for tech help.
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is working great! I love that I receive updates on when my cat has been fed. The release of food is quite precise. My cat is very smart and very greedy. We've had problems with other feeders being too easy to access a little extra food. This feeder has stopped that! The four stars are only because the company does not have tech service readily at hand. If you call, you may have to wait a little while for help. However, the trouble-shooting page is excellent. I was able to fix my problem on my own. You must be able to connect to a 2.4 G network!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E. Barker

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, once customer service replaces it for you - which will take months.
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered one about 2.5 years ago. It broke in less than 6 months. It took over 6 months for customer service to replace it. They suggested I switch my cats' food instead, so I strongly suspect no one on their team has ever met a cat. The replacement works...ok. The free ramp they sent out recently helps a lot. But it's not a good product - merely ok. Luckily, I've had no large pieces of rubber. But Having read those reviews, perhaps I'll stop using it. It's not reliable, the app is glitchy and slow, it has no features to allow for multiple cats, and the customer service is abysmal.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Like others, I had an issue with black rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the feeder on 11/12/2015. Like others, I had an issue with black rubber bits breaking off into the feeder, starting in the summer of 2016. I called the company and they sent me a replacement. The replacement version has been working fine since then, though the company sent an additional replacement recently - which also had some design changes. Although I clearly would have preferred to purchase it once and have no issues, the company has been responsive and it works perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: David Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and great product
customer_reviews.text: We had 2 defective ones. Waiting to receive replacement. Great idea but poor execution so far:( Edit: 10/13/15 I have received another unit directly from Petnet. Now it is working. Great high quality product and great customer support & technical service. Apparently amazon.com have few defective ones. Petnet has been proactive to resolve the issue. After 3 defective units, 4th one that I received directly from Petnet is great. Therefore one star goes to 5! I will provide an update in a month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Rifat Gorener

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device!!
customer_reviews.text: This smart feeder has been amazing! Maybe all the bad or mediocre reviews are from when it was in beta but I have had 0 problems in a little over a month. It is a life saver. My Frenchie pup is usually alone for only one meal out of 3 but sometimes 2. It dispenses perfectly and he loves it! The first two days we had it he did try to scratch the sides a bit but when he realized he'd never get into it he gave up. He knows the dispensing sound now and runs over so excited when it's time for a meal.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana__

customer_reviews.title: Love it Love it... oh did I mention, LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS FEEDER! Definitely go through the instructions for set-up. It's not hard, but it's not exactly plug and play either. I wish there was an Android interface, since my personal phones have always been Android; fortunately my work phone is an iPhone. The auto feed is awesome because of my schedule. I forgot to turn it off on one of my trips, but got on my phone and did it right there no problem. It'd be cool if there was a way they could tell if the food has been eaten or is still there. Maybe next gen product. Either way love this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Quan H. Doan

customer_reviews.title: Great product except for the support.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product now for years and for the most part it works great except for the fact that the generation 1 gets plugged up from time to time. The support, however Is non-existent. I have tried to get in touch over email and phone with no success or response.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: worth the cost. we have a small dog that ...
customer_reviews.text: worth the cost. we have a small dog that eats twice a day {like clock work}. this keeps her on schedule and allows us more flexibility. sound of food dispensing and hitting the bowl is the only noise. you will get use to it and it triggers the dogs attention. without it they wouldn't know there was food to eat. Update Jan 2017. The feeder rubber parts broke off. Was promised a replacement. After 30 days ... buying another. Hoping two times is the charm!
customer_reviews.author: LarryAndChelena

customer_reviews.title: Latest version is a rock solid product!
customer_reviews.text: Initial beta product worked okay (as long as I taped the cord and bottom tray down). Last month they contacted me and sent me a brand new unit (free of charge). This new unit has all the bugs worked out and has been great (improved charging cord placement, better mechanical connections, tilted base so food falls out better, etc). Really like their customer service and caring for previous buyers by sending out improved equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: I'm not super pleased as I thought I would be
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. My app always gives me a wifi connection error even when I am home, it feeds at times it is not supposed too, and the food gets trapped in the little alleyway before it makes it to the feeding dish so feds don't get fed. I'm not pleased as I thought I would be.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pet feeder!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our cats to test before we go away in December. It is amazing! We are going to buy a second one because we are so happy with it. Our pet sitter is going to download the app and keep an eye on it for us while we are gone. It works great and is fairly easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: Edith Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Their server is always down
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Their server is always down, and there is no app manual feed button. Have to be at the feeder. Worst is that it won't feed small portions (we have an 8lb cat, doesn't take much). It's like no one tested it. It might work for larger feeds, but the small portions get stuck up in the until and don't slide down the tray. And then it backs up and has to be manually cleared, to start the backing up process all over again. Would be awesome if they fixed it. Until then, for us, it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Green

customer_reviews.title: Good product if it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this product. It generally works as advertised, with the exception that the food jams every time it's dispensed. I contacted the manufacturer and they told me this was a common problem, I just need to clean the tray after each feeding (3x a day, in my case). This actually does work, but the problem is now I have an automatic feeding system that requires more maintenance than a simple bowl. It unfortunate, and I hope they fix the design flaw - they just need to increase the angle of the chute where the food comes out. I would purchase again if it was fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that I was unable to register this smart feeder. Emailed Petnet customer support details of my issue and there was no response from them so I had no other choice than to return the product. The unit looked sturdy and well designed.
customer_reviews.author: AZgirl

customer_reviews.title: They have another one like this and have found it easy to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: We have not used this but loaned it to a family member and I assume it worked well. Have not heard otherwise. They have another one like this and have found it easy to use and very handy when they have to be away from home.
customer_reviews.author: L. Alworth

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this cat feeder
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this cat feeder. Best investment ever, and haven't had ANY trouble with it after 7+ months of use. When setting up, I didn't take the sticker off when attempting to sync my phone, but other than my operator error it was super easy! Update October 2016: When moving, something happened to the plug-in on unit and it would no longer charge. I emailed Petnet support (email is key!) and they are sending a brand new replacement unit - I just got the tracking info. I love this product, and am anxious to purchase additional units for my other cats as I have the funds!
customer_reviews.author: M. Whitlow

customer_reviews.title: The best automatic pet feeder
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was waking us up at all hours to be fed and it was disrupting our sleep schedule so bad that we needed to get an automatic feeder for her. After researching all of the different feeders and initially buying a rotating tray feeder, we wanted something more. So we decided to spend the money for the Petnet. It has been the best investment that we have made for our cat so far. When we aren’t home for long periods during the day (or even overnight and on trips) we no longer have to worry if she has enough food. It has definitely paid for itself over and over since we bought it. Thanks Petnet!
customer_reviews.author: Lea Young

customer_reviews.title: The website says there is a two year limited warranty but the fine print says one year
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY - the product worked for about a year and then stopped working. The power source on the back of the product has to be held a specific way for the power to stay on. Once I let go, it turns off and the battery does not charge. It is extremely unreliable. In addition, I have called and e-mailed the company multiple times about this issue with no response. The website says there is a two year limited warranty but the fine print says one year. Unfortunately, I can't reach anyone at the company to clarify this contradiction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Winner!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few silly things for my dog, including an automatic doggie door and treat dispenser. This, however, isn't so silly! It's great. It does not really tell you how much your dog is eating or when, or video chat's you at all, so don't be misled by that, but it lets you know when food is short, etc. I like this a lot, and my dog seems to be eating when the food is let down, which is great!
customer_reviews.author: #CWP

customer_reviews.title: I like that it schedules feedings and makes it easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's just ok. I like that it schedules feedings and makes it easy to set and forget. however, every couple of days i have to lift the feeder to make the food stuck in tunnel go into the tray. I've washed the tray and tried different cat food, but the food never comes all the way out into the food tray. If i don't lift it, the feeder jams. I also find the 'empty hopper' note to not be timely. i wish there was a notification that says 'food low'. i saw it once, but i doesn't seem to be consistent. Overall, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Short shelf life
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 2 years then stopped working properly so I had to buy a new one....seems like it should last longer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: This product had some bad reviews that worried me but I've been using it ...
customer_reviews.text: This product had some bad reviews that worried me but I've been using it for about over three months now and everything is working just fine. I really love how easy to use it is and how I can control it from anywhere. It gives me reminders when my food is low or when the power/internet cuts off and my fur babies miss a feeding. Which gives me peace of mind when traveling. I'd definitely buy a second unit in the future, and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I have had this feeder since the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have had this feeder since the beta version, and now the latest upgraded version. It works very reliably and I love the text messages letting me know if there are any issues. For example if the food level is low or there was a power failure etc. A lot of people can build a feeder to just dispense food but one that communicates back to you makes it special. I have had very good luck with customer service when I had a few issues setting it up. Thank you Petnet.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a reliable pet feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing the Petnet, I couldn't find a reliable automated feeder for my two cats. In fact, one of my previous purchases started smoking after inserting batteries! Although the Petnet isn't perfect, its hardware is very well constructed, and it has perfectly kept to the feeding schedule since setting it up. The feeder does struggle to push smaller kibble into the feeding tray, but my cats easily fish out the food with their paws. Larger, "dental" foods have worked excellently with the mechanism and are ejected fully into the tray. I love being able to adjust the feeding schedule from my phone, and the "feed now" button helps when the cats bother me in the night for an extra feeding.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Unmatched Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Product works great! Petnet customer service is unmatched. Was notified that my base feeder might have problems and when they surfaced, Petnet sent me a replacement base overnight. Set up was pretty easy. I learned that I had to take my iPhone out of its protective case to allow it to communicate with the bowl unit. Once set the unit feeds my cat on schedule. Very satisfied that my cat gets fed even if I am late or on travel for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S. Whitelaw

customer_reviews.title: The actual product is very cool and makes feeding your pet easier when you can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Customer service wasn't able to help me resolve the issue with my feeder; however, they were top notch at responding in a timely fashion and offering a replacement or refund. The actual product is very cool and makes feeding your pet easier when you can't be home. I do think it needs a larger bowl as the one with this feeder is rather small and my English Bulldog has a difficult time eating out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

product_meta.title: Petnet SmartFeeder, Automatic Pet Feeder for Cats and Dogs, Compatible with Alexa
product_meta.description:
We believe the best nutrition for your pet is personalized. Petnet will help you make intelligent decisions when it comes to your pet's food -- bringing you joy while keeping your pets healthy and happy. The SmartFeeder will help you manage feeding times, portion sizes, proper ingredients, and have your pet's food delivered right to your doorstep. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


Control your pet's feeding from your smartphone The Petnet App gives you peace of mind in the palm of your hand ensuring your pet is always being fed, no matter where you are. 

Take the guesswork out of feeding your pet SmartFeeder measures portions based on your pet's age, weight, and level of activity - so you can ensure your pet is eating the right amount of food every time. 


Healthy Portion SmartFeeder lets you set feeding times and programs itself to dispense your pet's ideal food portion, so you can put an end to overfeeding. 


Proper Ingredients Choosing the right food for your pet can be confusing. SmartFeeder matches your pet with the ideal food recipe to ensure your pet is properly fed. 


Food Delivery SmartFeeder monitors how much food supply you have in your home and ships more when you're running low. 



Peace of Mind Our goal is to simplify your life by delivering your pet's ideal food directly to your doorstep. We'll help you make intelligent decisions when it comes to your pet's food -- bringing you joy while keeping your pets healthy and happy. 

About the Startup 
Describe your product in 3 words.

Smarter pet feeding.

Where did you get the inspiration for your product?

Petnet was born out of our love for our pets and the passion for how best to improve their lives. SmartFeeder does this by providing proper and consistent nutrition that will have both immediate and long lasting effects to their health and wellbeing.

What differentiates your product from similar products out there?

The SmartFeeder is truly “smart.” It uses sensors, learning software, the power of the cloud, the world’s largest pet food database, and your smartphone to learn and understand your pet’s nutritional needs. It then uses this information to match your pet to the perfect portion and ideal ingredients specific to your pet’s age, weight, level of activity and breed. You can control the SmartFeeder from anywhere in the world. Using your smartphone, you can manage feeding times, portion sizes, food recipes, and receive notifications about feedings, battery life and much more. And of course, since everyone dreads going to the store to buy food, the SmartFeeder even has your pet’s food delivered right to your doorstep.

Tell us about the best and most challenging parts of the creation process.

The most challenging part of the creation process was to truly understand the everyday problems pet owners face when feeding their pets and design a simple to use solution to address those problems. We discovered that this came down to three things: portion control, compatible ingredients, and food delivery. For most pet owners, it’s nearly impossible to understand the food labels on a pet food bag and to then ensure that particular formula addresses your pet’s nutritional needs. And of course, the age old question “how much am I supposed to feed my pet?”. The answers to these questions are not obvious and often take a lot of time and research to figure out. Our goal at Petnet was to design a feeder that addressed portion control specific to your pet, matched your pet with the right ingredients, and eliminated the hassle of having to run to the store to buy food. In the end, we reached our goal and simplified feeding for everyone.
feature_bullets: 2017 new and improved SmartFeeder features include a stronger feeding wheel, better bowl connection
All purchases include an offer for a free SmartFeeder ramp, designed for kibbles that need help sliding into the bowl. (shipped from Petnet after product registration)
Using the Petnet app you can personalize food portions and automate your pet's meal schedule
Get notifications for meals served, low food, delivery updates and more
Sign-up for SmartDelivery and have your pet's food delivered - SmartDelivery is still in beta and not all food recipes are available yet
